# Matthew Silver (historian)

Matthew Mark Silver () (July 28, 1961 - November 9, 2025) was an Israeli historian, professor at the  Max Stern Yezreel Valley College and at the University of Haifa. His main subjects were Israel studies and modern Jewish history.
M.M. Silver was born in the United States, graduated from the Cornell University, and emigrated to Israel in the mid 1980s. He earned his Ph.D. in Modern Jewish History from the  Hebrew University of Jerusalem. He is notable as an author of books on this topic and chronicling personalities in Modern Jewish History, notably Leon Uris, Louis Marshall and Gershon Agron.
